intro: Hoffmannia trichocalyx, commonly known as the African milk tree, is a deciduous shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its milky sap, which is toxic and can cause skin irritation. The plant typically grows to a height of 1–3 meters, featuring narrow, lance-shaped leaves and yellowish flowers. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and along riverbanks. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and traditional medicine practices.
